text.annotators: Natalia Bogomolova, Dmitry Ganenkov, Nils Schiborr
text.speaker: TS01

unit.utterance: sar aba.jiz aǯi šulu šubur baž, pirimna kerimna selim.
unit.utterance_translation: An old man had three sons: Pirim, Kerim, and Selim.

unit.utterance: mu aba.ji murar hacːi uˁ<r>χuˁru.
unit.utterance_translation: This old man brought them up in this way.

unit.utterance: sab darval, sab aˁzjat, fuvušq’a aˁjdarǯi, aba uǯub zehmetkeš aji insan vuǯi šulu, uǯub devlet aji, uǯur hadmuq’an čan qu<r>q’uvalar aǯi.
unit.utterance_translation: Not knowing either need or pain or anything, the old man was a good, industrious man, who had good wealth, had such good achievements.

unit.utterance: sab.ǯikanq’a fikir ktːarǯi mu bažar aˁχuˁ šulu.
unit.utterance_translation: The boys grew up without worrying about anything.

unit.utterance: čpːi fu ʁip’nuš, fu ʁu<b>qnuš aˁjdarǯi, naʔna ʁafnuš q’adar adarǯi hamcːi čpːiz guni si dulanmiš šulaǯi šulu murar.
unit.utterance_translation: They didn't know what they ate, what they drank, able to go anywhere and they were living the way they wanted.

unit.utterance: insan.ǯin uˁmur hacːib u aˁχir adrub dar, varib.ǯiz aˁχir ajib vu.
unit.utterance_translation: Human life is not such that it does not have an end, there is an end to everything.

unit.utterance: jiʁar.ikan sad jiʁ.an aba aldaknu aˁru raˁhmat.ǯiz.
unit.utterance_translation: One of those days the old man fell down and passed away to the Merciful.

unit.utterance: aba raˁhmat.ǯiz ʁušnu, bažar.i vari aˁdat dap’nu, čpːin abara kivnu, salamat dap’nu, sadaq’ara tuvnu dusru.
unit.utterance_translation: The old man passed away to the Merciful, the sons performed all the customs, buried their father, laid him to rest, distributed alms, and continued their lives.

unit.utterance: c’ib vaχt.nalan dadara raˁhmat.ǯiz aˁru.
unit.utterance_translation: After a little while, their mother also passed away.

unit.utterance: mura salamat ap’uru.
unit.utterance_translation: They also buried her.

unit.utterance: muvanra k’an k’ul dap’nu, čpːin vari aˁdatar duˁ<r>χnu, lamus duˁ<b>χnu, čpːin jasra duˁ<b>χnu dada.jinra adaš.inra, hamcːi vaχtːar ʁušnu.
unit.utterance_translation: (They) buried their parents, preserved all their customs, preserved their dignity, and mourned for their mother and father, this is how time went by.

unit.utterance: qana čpːin dulanmiš ap’uri dusru.
unit.utterance_translation: And they continued to live.

unit.utterance: χabar naʔna?
unit.utterance_translation: What was next?

unit.utterance: čpːizra aˁjdarǯi, bažar.in devlet šulu c’ib gudu<b>k’ura.
unit.utterance_translation: Without them realizing, the boys' money was shrinking, then ran out.

unit.utterance: vah, liguru, amdar.
unit.utterance_translation: They look: Ah, there is nothing left!

unit.utterance: ja pirim, ja kerim ja selim, hap’ru, ficːi ap’uru?
unit.utterance_translation: Perim, Kerim, Selim, how are we doing, what are we going to do?

unit.utterance: pirim.ǯi k’ur javašir k’ur, uzu aˁχuˁr vuza k’ur
unit.utterance_translation: Pirim said, Hold on, I am the oldest.

unit.utterance: uc̊u ʁuzir k’ur, uzu uxuz laˁχin a<b>guz aˁrza k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: You stay (at home), I am going to search for work for us.

unit.utterance: i<b>šri k’ur
unit.utterance_translation: They say: Ok!

unit.utterance: ligir ha uc̊u, ix χal k’ul.i ʁeje<b>χir k’ur, aji adrub.ǯiz ligir k’ur
unit.utterance_translation: He said: You look after things, take care of our house, look after everything!

unit.utterance: uzu uxuz laˁχin a<b>gurza k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: I will find a job for us.

unit.utterance: pirim ʁada<b>ʁnu čaz ala<b>xru palatra, huˁǯuˁχru palatra ʁada<b>ʁnu, erčnu čan hirbin ʁuˁn.i, uc̊’ru lik.ri düz šahur teref.naz aˁru mu.
unit.utterance_translation: Pirim took the clothes that he was wearing, took clothes to change into, put his saddle bag on his shoulder, set off, and headed right in the direction of a city.

unit.utterance: adaquru šahr.iǯi.
unit.utterance_translation: He found himself in the city.

unit.utterance: šahr.iz adaqu pirim e<r>gru.
unit.utterance_translation: Finding himself in the city, Pirim was exhausted.

unit.utterance: gašra du<b>xnajir, javaš javašǯi a<b>guri, adaquru sab čajχani.ǯi.
unit.utterance_translation: Hungry, he slowly searched and entered a teahouse.

unit.utterance: dusnu hadinǯi, sab čajnik’ra ʁada<b>ʁnu, fikrara ap’uri jarabala, hap’zajk’e? ficːi ap’uzajk’e, f.ǯila gaˁ<b>ʁzajk’e? laˁχin ʁap’ur dar, fu kavuk ʁapige, k’uz šuladar kespira, hap’za k’ur, hamcːdar fikrara ap’uri uquri čajra dusnege.
unit.utterance_translation: He sat there, ordered a teapot, and thought: O, my goodness, what am I going to do, how am I going to do it, where am I going to start, one who's never worked? If they ask: What can you do, I can't name a profession, what am I going to do? He had such thoughts and drank tea while sitting.

unit.utterance: qa havaz ʁanšarna dusnaǯi šulu sar uǯur zurba, uǯur admi.
unit.utterance_translation: It happened that a rich, very rich man was sitting across (the table).

unit.utterance: ala<b>xu sab uǯub bačuk’, uǯub palat, uǯub us̊.ni ʁizil.in spːar, t’ub.aq ʁizil.in t’ulbnar hamcːir admi dusnaǯi šulu.
unit.utterance_translation: Having a good sheepskin hat, good clothes, having gold teeth in mouth, golden rings on his fingers, such a man happened to be sitting there.

unit.utterance: hamu liguraǯi šulu pirim.ǯin ap’uraji fikrar.iqǯi.
unit.utterance_translation: It turned out that he had been observing Pirim thinking.

unit.utterance: aˁχir ǯaχ ap’uru mu.
unit.utterance_translation: Finally, he called him.

unit.utterance: ja ǯihil k’ur, fu χabar u k’ur, jaman fikrar ap’urava aˁχir k’ur, fujav derdi k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Ah, boy, what's up, you are having bad thoughts, what's bothering you?

unit.utterance: vallah, χalu k’ur, hamcːi k’ur, sab laˁχin abxniš ap’uz k’ur, uduc̊urijza k’ur ap’uz, laˁχn.iq licuraza k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: O, uncle, this is the issue, if you have work to do, I would do it, I am looking for a job.

unit.utterance: qa laˤχin uzu tuvurzavuz k’ur, eger kaǯaš laˤχin.
unit.utterance_translation: I will give you a job, if you are capable of doing the job.

unit.utterance: qa fu kavuk k’ur
unit.utterance_translation: So what can you do?

unit.utterance: vallah k’ur, dicːi uzuk sab kespi ktːarzuk k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: I do not have any profession.

unit.utterance: qa funub vušra ap’uraza k’ur abxiš.
unit.utterance_translation: But in that case I will do whatever the job would be.

unit.utterance: qa i<b>šri k’ur, vujige uzu ʁapi laˁχin ap’i k’ur
unit.utterance_translation: Well then, do the work I tell you.

unit.utterance: uzu uvuz pulra turzavuz k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: I will also give you money.

unit.utterance: uzu uvuz daqrus̊ra tuvurzavuz k’ur, ip’ru ülla.
unit.utterance_translation: I will give you a place to sleep and food to eat.

unit.utterance: i<b>šri k’ur, uzuz gunibra hacːibč’a dazuz ʁapnu.
unit.utterance_translation: Pirim said: Alright, I want nothing more than that.

unit.utterance: i<b>šri, k’ur, ap’arza, χalu k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Good, I'll do it, uncle.

unit.utterance: ʁač k’ur, vujige.
unit.utterance_translation: Come with me, if so.

unit.utterance: aˁru murar χʷl.az.
unit.utterance_translation: They went to (his) house.

unit.utterance: aˁru χʷl.az, ulupuru muvaz daqru χalla du<b>χnu ǯibru ülra muvaz, ip’ru ülla ǯibru muvaz.
unit.utterance_translation: They went to (his) house, he showed him a room to sleep in, brought bread and put it out for him, put food out for him.

unit.utterance: maha k’ur uvuz χal, maha ip’rubra k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Here is a room for you, here is food.

unit.utterance: tːolkːa k’ur, uzu k’ur, ʁapi birmiš ap’urva k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: You will only do the instructions that I give you.

unit.utterance: tːolkːa sab k’urzavuz k’ur, qaˁl ʁuˁb dari<b>šri k’ur, qaˤl ʁuˤb dari<b>šri k’ur, sar sar.ika
unit.utterance_translation: I'll tell you only one thing, let's not be angry with each other.

unit.utterance: i<b>šri k’ur pirim.ǯi
unit.utterance_translation: Alright, Pirim said.

unit.utterance: fu gaf vujav k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Why are you saying these words?

unit.utterance: uzuz ip’ru ülla, daqru χalla, uvu uzuz pulla tuvige, qaˁl haz ʁuˤruqa k’ur uzuz.
unit.utterance_translation: Why would I be angry if you give me food to eat, a room to sleep in, and money?

unit.utterance: i<b>šri k’ur vujige.
unit.utterance_translation: If so, good.

unit.utterance: dip’u ülla, daq k’ur gač’.ni izn.iz aˁrva k’ur jicara git’nu.
unit.utterance_translation: Now eat the food and go to sleep, in the morning you'll yoke the oxen and go ploughing.

unit.utterance: daqru pirim givnu k’ul.ig χlara.
unit.utterance_translation: Pirim lay down and put his hands under his head.

unit.utterance: gač’in šulu.
unit.utterance_translation: Then morning came.

unit.utterance: riʁ ala<b>ximič’la kučru hin ʁuduʒ̊ k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: When the sun had only just risen, they knocked [at the door] and said: Get up!

unit.utterance: jicar git’na k’ur, [UNCLEAR] dušu k’ur, ap’i k’ur izan.
unit.utterance_translation: The oxen are yoked, go and plough the field.

unit.utterance: ap’urza k’ur pirim.ǯi, ʁada<b>ʁnu, jicara ʁadaʁnu qavnu jicarra ilipu durucra aˤru.
unit.utterance_translation: Pirim said, I'll do it, and he took the oxen, drove the oxen, put the plough down, and went along.

unit.utterance: gaˁ<b>ʁru pirim.ǯi izan ap’uz.
unit.utterance_translation: Pirim started ploughing the field.

unit.utterance: izan ap’uru, ap’uru, riʁra udu<b>c̊’uru
unit.utterance_translation: He ploughed and ploughed, the sun rose.

unit.utterance: mani šulu, adar ül, χuradar.
unit.utterance_translation: It became hot, there was no bread, they didn't bring any.

unit.utterance: ja šid χuradar fužk’ara adar.
unit.utterance_translation: Neither did they bring water, there was nobody (else).

unit.utterance: ap’uru izan, aˁχ ap’uru, aˁχ ap’uru muvu, jiʁar lisin šulu.
unit.utterance_translation: He ploughed the field, he suffered, the day approached noon.

unit.utterance: fužk’ara ʁuˁradar.
unit.utterance_translation: Nobody came.

unit.utterance: aˁχir sanu hamu jiʁan ʁuzru mu ficːivušra.
unit.utterance_translation: In the end he somehow stayed (this way) that day.

unit.utterance: ja kas k’ur, aˁχ ap’iǯiza k’ur, fuk’ara abxun šul k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: He said: I will be patient, maybe something will happen.

unit.utterance: [UNCLEAR] sabur tuvnu ʁuˁru χaˁbaˁq.ǯi pirim
unit.utterance_translation: Pirim was patient and returned in the evening.

unit.utterance: qavnu jicara, uc̊’nu urar.ǯi.
unit.utterance_translation: Driving the oxen, he entered the yard.

unit.utterance: hajat.ǯiǯi uc̊’igen qa liguru hamu aˁχuˁ ijesi dusnaǯi šulu ajvan.ǯiq čaj uquri hap’uva, hap’uva, pirim k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: When he entered the yard, he looked around: the master was sitting on the balcony, drinking tea and asking: How are you, how are you, Pirim?

unit.utterance: qaˁlqre si gafar ap’uru, hap’uva.
unit.utterance_translation: He spoke as if mocking: How are you?

unit.utterance: vallah k’ur, manira abxuvuz ha.
unit.utterance_translation: It's been hot for you.

unit.utterance: e<r>gnura vuva ha k’ur
unit.utterance_translation: And you are tired.

unit.utterance: e<r>gnura šul k’ur, fn.i ülla adaǯi, hap’nik’e uvu k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: You are tired, how are you doing without having food in your stomach?

unit.utterance: pirim.ǯi sanu hamcːi ʁapige, čak kaˁqrajib aˁʁuˁ ʁabxige, ap’uru muvaz nuˁq’nar.
unit.utterance_translation: When he said so, Pirim started scolding him, thinking that he was mocking him.

unit.utterance: jav devlet.ǯikra c’a ka<b>qrijav k’ur, jav hamu uvu duk’u sadaq’.iz i<b>šrijav k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: May your wealth burn, may it become alms for your death!

unit.utterance: hatmu hamu ix č’al.iinǯi ap’uru muvaz aˁχuˁ nuˁq’nar.
unit.utterance_translation: He said to him serious curses in our language.

unit.utterance: hap’nu, pirim, qaˁl ʁafunuz k’ur?
unit.utterance_translation: What happened, Pirim? Have you gotten angry?

unit.utterance: značit qaˁl ʁafige murar.in, značit jiq’rar hacːib vu urχub gardan jivub.
unit.utterance_translation: So the agreement was to cut off their heads if they get angry.

unit.utterance: birmiš ap’uru vezirar.iz ʁadaʁir k’ur sanu uzxa hadmu.
unit.utterance_translation: He gave the order to the servants: Take him away from me.

unit.utterance: pirim ʁaˁdavuru murar.i.
unit.utterance_translation: They took Pirim.

unit.utterance: hamus kerimna selim giligura, pirim ʁuˁru k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: At this time Kerim and Selim were waiting, Is Pirim coming back?.

unit.utterance: sab vaz aˁ<b>ʁuˁru, q’uˁb vaz aˁru, sis č’uk’ adar, gaf č’al adar, ǯaχ ǯik’ adar.
unit.utterance_translation: One month passed, two months passed, no news, no talk, no nothing.

unit.utterance: aˁχir kerim.ǯi k’ur, uzxa aˁχ ap’uz šuladazxa k’ur ʁardaš dušnu.
unit.utterance_translation: Finally, Kerim said: I can't stand anymore that our brother is gone.

unit.utterance: muvaz k’ur fuk’ara abxnu šul k’ur, daš mu ʁuˁrur u k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Something must have happened to him, otherwise he would have come back.

unit.utterance: uzu aˁraza k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: I will go.

unit.utterance: uduc̊’uru selim-- kerim ʁada<b>ʁnu čan palatra, erčnu ʁuˁn.i herbira, hamu raˁqː.ǯi adaqus̊.aǯi adaqri k’ur, hele aˁǯaza k’ur, [UNCLEAR] i<b>šri.
unit.utterance_translation: Kerim took his clothes, put the bag on his shoulders, went out on the road, and said: Whatever place I find myself in, let me be there, I am now going, let it be.

unit.utterance: licuri, licuri, licuri, licuri aˁru, aˁru mu aˁχir adaquru mu šahr.iǯi, qanara hamura
unit.utterance_translation: He went and searched, went and searched, finally he happened to be in the city, this time it was him.

unit.utterance: hamu pirim adaqu čajχain.ǯi adaquru mu.
unit.utterance_translation: He happened to be in the teahouse where Pirim had been.

unit.utterance: dusnu hams̊a e<r>gnajir, u<b>quri čajra, ap’uri fikrar, hap’zajk’e, ficːi ap’uzajk’e, fu herχuzajk’e, šl.ixa herχuzajk’e, naʔana a<b>guzajk’e laˤχin k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: He was sitting at this place, tired, drinking tea and thinking: What am I going to do, how am I going to do [it], what should I ask, who should I ask, where should I look for work?

unit.utterance: hamcːi fikir ap’uraǯi livuru, hamu admi adaquru qana hamina.
unit.utterance_translation: Having these thoughts, he looked: that man happened to be there.

unit.utterance: livuru, dufnajib, ʁiraʁ.ǯila dufnajib, aˁʁu šulu muvaz.
unit.utterance_translation: He (the man) looked and understood that he (Kerim) had come from a distant place.

unit.utterance: miʁar.i mus̊a ajir dar, fu χabar, ǯihil, k’ur, jaman fikrar ap’urava aˁχir, fu jav derdi k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Nothing has happened here these days, what's up, young man, you are having bad thoughts, what's your problem?

unit.utterance: fuk’ara adru darub anev k’ur, fuk’ara abxib aji k’ur
unit.utterance_translation: Is something missing from you? Something has happened.

unit.utterance: χat’a bala dubxnaji k’ur
unit.utterance_translation: Something bad happened.

unit.utterance: vallah k’ur, hamcːi k’ur ʁardaš liχuz ʁušnu, ʁardašra ʁafundar k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Oh, my brother has gone off to work and has not come back.

unit.utterance: ja ič χʷl.a ip’rubra amdar k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: And there is no food left in our house.

unit.utterance: hamcːi laˁχin a<b>guri, uduc̊’nejruza k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: So I went out to look for work.

unit.utterance: hap’rušra aˁǯuz duxnedaruča k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: We do not know what to do.

unit.utterance: qa laˁχin ajis̊ uzu k’urzavuz k’ur, eger uvu ap’ruš k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: I'll tell you where there is work, if you would do it.

unit.utterance: qa hap’ru, baja χalu, k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: What should I do, dear uncle?

unit.utterance: laˁχin k’ur jiz χʷl.a guniq’a ajiz k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: There is a lot of work to do at my home, whatever you want.

unit.utterance: eger uzu ʁapib ap’ruš k’ur, uzu k’uraji jiq’rar.iinǯi uvu laˁχin ap’uruš, uzu turzavuz k’ur laˁχin.
unit.utterance_translation: If you do what I say and work according to the agreement I say, I'll give you a job.

unit.utterance: qa ficːdar vujav k’ur
unit.utterance_translation: Well, what are those?

unit.utterance: ip’ru uˁlla turzavuz, dusru χalra turzavuz k’ur, pulra turzavuz, uzu ʁapi laˁχin ap’i k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: I'll give you food, I'll give you a room to live in, I'll give you money, just do the work I say.

unit.utterance: anǯaʁ qaˁl ʁuˁb dari<b>šri k’ur sar sar.ika, qaˁl ʁafir.in gardan jivub.
unit.utterance_translation: Just let us not be angry with each other, the one who is angry will have his head cut off.

unit.utterance: vah, fu gaf vujav χalu k’ur, haz qaˁl ʁuˁru uzuz uvka k’ur, muq’andar fura turege, uǯuvlar turege.
unit.utterance_translation: Oh, what are you saying, uncle, why would I be angry with you when you give me so much of this, when you give me good things?

unit.utterance: ap’urza k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: I will do it.

unit.utterance: ʁač k’ur ix χʷl.az.
unit.utterance_translation: Then come to our house!

unit.utterance: qaǯi aˁru kerimra, qaǯi dušnu, kerimra ditnu, ulupuru muvaz daqru jis̊ra.
unit.utterance_translation: He took Kerim with him, sat him down, and showed him a place to sleep.

unit.utterance: dubχnu uˁlra hibu ulix, hamus daq k’ur
unit.utterance_translation: He brought bread, put it in front of him, and said: Now, go to sleep!

unit.utterance: zakur gač’ni haˁzur jix k’ur ign.iz aˁʁuz.
unit.utterance_translation: Tomorrow morning be ready to go to the field.

unit.utterance: daqru kerim, dip’u uˁlra.
unit.utterance_translation: Kerit ate the bread and went to sleep.

unit.utterance: jarab allah k’ur, hamu uzuz raˁ<b>qːuˁrajib nimk’i k’ur, daršiš muk’a uǯur admi ficːirik’e k’ur, mu hap’rurik’e mu.
unit.utterance_translation: Oh God, am I dreaming, for if not, how can there be such a good man, what is he doing?

unit.utterance: daqru χalra k’ur, ip’ru uˁlra, pulra k’ur, laˁχinra k’ur, jada, daqru fikrar ap’uri jis̊ adap’uru.
unit.utterance_translation: Oh, a place to sleep, food to eat, money, a job, he spent the night lying and thinking.

unit.utterance: gač’ni kučru muvaz, gudu<b>k’, kerim, gudu<b>k’, riʁ udu<b>c̊’ajiz, ʁaraχ k’ur izn.iz.
unit.utterance_translation: In the morning they knocked [at the door to wake] him: Get ready, Kerim, get ready, go to the field before the sun rises.

unit.utterance: ʁuduʒ̊uru mu.
unit.utterance_translation: He got up.

unit.utterance: haˁjaˁt.ǯiʔ di<r>kna zurba q’uˤb aˁχuˁ jicara gada<b>xu puf, ilipu durucra.
unit.utterance_translation: Two big oxen were standing in the yard, breathing heavily, with a plough tied to them.

unit.utterance: kerimra uǯur q’uvat aji baž uǯi šulu.
unit.utterance_translation: Kerim was a big guy with much strength.

unit.utterance: aˁru mu.
unit.utterance_translation: He went.

unit.utterance: ulupuru muvaz hakmu χʷt’il, dušnu k’ur, hakmu k’ul.iamina izan ap’i k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: They showed him that field and said: Plough the field from that side on.

unit.utterance: ap’uru muvu izan.
unit.utterance_translation: He ploughed the field.

unit.utterance: gaˁbru izan ap’uz.
unit.utterance_translation: He started ploughing.

unit.utterance: ha sab saˤaˁt, quˁb saˤaˁt, šubub saˤaˁt, riʁ udu<b>c̊’uru.
unit.utterance_translation: One hour, two hours, three hours, the sun rose.

unit.utterance: mani šulu, šid gun šulu.
unit.utterance_translation: It became hot, he wanted to drink water.

unit.utterance: jicara gah aˁradar muvan, bizar ap’ura.
unit.utterance_translation: Sometimes his oxen did not go, exhausting him.

unit.utterance: ja ulxa bisrur adar, ja muvaxna ʁuˤrer adar.
unit.utterance_translation: There was no one who could hold (them) from the front, neither was anyone coming for him.

unit.utterance: ja salam adar, ja kalam adar, ja šid adar.
unit.utterance_translation: There was no call, there was no word (from anyone), there was no water.

unit.utterance: jada k’ur, mu fu aˁlamat u k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: He said: What wonder is this?

unit.utterance: havu uzuz ʁapi gafar naani k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Where are the words that he said to me.

unit.utterance: havu ap’ureb fu vu k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: What is he doing?

unit.utterance: hajaman havaz fuk’a abxun šul k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Something must have happened to him.

unit.utterance: mura sanu aˁχ dap’nu, mu jiʁan sanu č’alq’a k’urdar.
unit.utterance_translation: He had patience and did not say anything that day.

unit.utterance: χaˁbaˁq.ǯizxa izan ap’uru kerim.ǯi
unit.utterance_translation: Kerim ploughed the field until evening.

unit.utterance: hamu χʷt’il gudu<b>k’uru muvu.
unit.utterance_translation: He finished this field.

unit.utterance: χaˁbaˤq.ǯi qavnu jicara, amanna adarǯi ǯan.ǯi, ʁuˁru mu javaš javašǯi, guǯ.naz likar gadaʁuri, ʁuˁru mu.
unit.utterance_translation: In the evening he drove the oxen, with no energy left in his body, he went very slowly, taking steps with effort.

unit.utterance: t’avnu urara, uc̊’ru, liguru, hamu dusna ajvan.ǯiq u<b>quri čajra haˁhjir ap’uri čan χpːar.iqǯi, zaraftara ap’uri, χu.jiz ülira gat’axuri hamu ajvan.ǯiqa.
unit.utterance_translation: He opened the doors, went in, looked: that one is sitting on the balcony, drinking tea, laughing with his wife, joking, throwing bread to his dog from the balcony.

unit.utterance: hamcːdar ap’uri dusnige, kerim.ǯiz dünja k’aru šulu.
unit.utterance_translation: While he is sitting and doing all these things, the world became black for Kerim.

unit.utterance: hap’uva, vah, vah kerim ʁuˁra k’ur, kerim ʁuˤra.
unit.utterance_translation: How are you doing? Oh, Kerim is coming, Kerim is coming.

unit.utterance: hap’uva k’ur, kerim, hap’uva?
unit.utterance_translation: How are you doing, Kerim, how are you?

unit.utterance: ej behem fu abxunvuz ha ǯan k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Hey, dear, what's happened to you?

unit.utterance: vallah k’ur, uvuxna uˁl χrurra axundar k’ur, šid χrurra axundar k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Oh, there was nobody who could bring you food, there was nobody who could bring you water.

unit.utterance: hap’nik’e uvu k’ur ʁi.ǯin jiʁ, gizaf manibra vuj ha k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: I wonder how you managed today, it was very hot.

unit.utterance: jarab jicar.ira bizar ʁap’un šul uvu k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: And the oxen probably exhausted you.

unit.utterance: hamcːi sanu kerim.ǯiz jamanǯi qaˁl dufnu.
unit.utterance_translation: So Kerim became furious.

unit.utterance: ap’uru nuˁq’nar muvaz.
unit.utterance_translation: He threw curses at him.

unit.utterance: uvuz nač i<b>šrivuz k’ur, uvu ʁapi gafar nanijav k’ur, uvu učuz hamq’an insafsuzval haz ʁap’uva k’ur nuˁq’nar ap’uru.
unit.utterance_translation: You should be ashamed! Where are the words you said? Why are you so cruel to me? He curses him:

unit.utterance: jav sadaq.’iz išrijav jav jicara, jav devlet.nakra c’a ka<b>qrijav k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: May your oxen be for alms and may fire burn your wealth!

unit.utterance: hap’uzijav micːib devlet k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: What do I do with your wealth?

unit.utterance: hamcːdar ap’uru.
unit.utterance_translation: He acts in this way.

unit.utterance: qaˁl afunuz?
unit.utterance_translation: Are you angry?

unit.utterance: hadaʁir, k’ur mu.
unit.utterance_translation: Take him away!

unit.utterance: mura jik’uru.
unit.utterance_translation: They killed him too.

unit.utterance: χabar naʔna, χabar selim.ǯika.
unit.utterance_translation: Where was news, news about Selim.

unit.utterance: selim.ǯiz χabar šulu mu laˁχ.nikan.
unit.utterance_translation: Selim learnt about this deal.

unit.utterance: vallah k’ur, murar.iz aˁmal ʁap’ur sar vu k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Oh, this one is who tricked them.

unit.utterance: hamcːi ʁadaʁnu čan palatra, uduc̊’uru selim ʁardšar.in šil.naz.
unit.utterance_translation: Selim took his clothes and went out following his brothers trail.

unit.utterance: ʁuˁru selim hamu čajχan.iz.
unit.utterance_translation: Selim came to this teahouse.

unit.utterance: hamrar si dusru hamu ust’l.iq.
unit.utterance_translation: He took a seat at a table, just like them.

unit.utterance: aguru mu hamu χalu.di, hamura.
unit.utterance_translation: This old man looked for him, too.

unit.utterance: ja ǯihil, fu χabar u k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Hey, young man, what's the matter?

unit.utterance: laˁχin a<b>garana k’ur?
unit.utterance_translation: Are you looking for a job?

unit.utterance: ov, χalu k’ur, uzu k’ur laˁχin a<b>guri dufnaza k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Yes, uncle, I came in search of a job.

unit.utterance: uvu laχin tuvrajir vuna k’ur?
unit.utterance_translation: Are you the one who gives people work?

unit.utterance: ov k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Yes.

unit.utterance: hin qpaˁquru muvan gafar.iq selimra.
unit.utterance_translation: And Selim listened to his words well.

unit.utterance: maha k’ur, dusru χalla, ip’ru uˁlla.
unit.utterance_translation: Here is a room to sleep and food to eat.

unit.utterance: uvuz k’ur ʁiliχub.ǯia jav pulra tuvurzavuz k’ur, anǯaʁ k’ur qaˁl ʁuˁrub diri<b>šri k’ur ix ar.iʔ.
unit.utterance_translation: I will give you money for your work, only let there be no anger between us.

unit.utterance: vah, fu gaf vujav, χalu k’ur, haz qaˁl ʁuˁru k’ur uvu sir.ika.
unit.utterance_translation: Oh, what are you saying, uncle, why would I get angry with someone like you.

unit.utterance: ʁač k’ur, huc̊’ k’ur ulix.
unit.utterance_translation: Let's go, you go before me.

unit.utterance: aˁru murar.
unit.utterance_translation: They went.

unit.utterance: dip’u uˁlla daqru selim.
unit.utterance_translation: Selim ate the bread and lay down to sleep.

unit.utterance: qajiʁ.a gač’ni ha k’ur gudu<b>k’ selim k’ur jicar git’na k’ur ʁaraχ izn.iz.
unit.utterance_translation: Next morning he said: Wake up, Selim, the oxen are yoked, go to the field.

unit.utterance: aˁrxa, χalu, k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Let's go, uncle.

unit.utterance: ʁeǯe<r>gnu selim, dirbašvalra kaǯi šulu muvak čan uǯub.
unit.utterance_translation: Selim jumped up, he had great courage.

unit.utterance: aˁru izn.iz.
unit.utterance_translation: He went to the field.

unit.utterance: dušnu ap’uru muvu izan.
unit.utterance_translation: He went and ploughed the field.

unit.utterance: sab c’ib vaχt.nalan, ap’uru muvu izan, liguru riʁra udu<b>c̊’uru.
unit.utterance_translation: He ploughed the field and, in a short time, he saw that the sun was rising.

unit.utterance: sab tki sib mani šulu.
unit.utterance_translation: It became a bit hot.

unit.utterance: adar fužk’ara ʁuˁrajir.
unit.utterance_translation: Nobody was coming.

unit.utterance: muvura hap’ru, hamu jicar qavnu.
unit.utterance_translation: And what did he do, he led the oxen.

unit.utterance: dušnu, hamu sab ʁarz gaǯi šulu has̊ag, χʷt’l.ig, ʁun.
unit.utterance_translation: There was a rock under that place, under the ploughing field, a hill.

unit.utterance: hamu ʁun.ilamina diš a’puru muvu mu jicar.
unit.utterance_translation: He led the oxen off that hill.

unit.utterance: ʁaraχir barkavnar k’ur, uc̊uz micːi liχajiz k’ur, ʁijiχiš uǯi vuc̊uz k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Go, my dearies! It's better for you to die than to work like this.

unit.utterance: erčnu jicara, ʁada<b>ʁu hamu jicara qa<v>raji t’ulra, qibu gardan.ǯiq us̊us̊ jeburi ʁuˁru selim.
unit.utterance_translation: He pushed the oxen [off the cliff], took the stick he used to drive the oxen, put (it) on his neck, and came home whistling.

unit.utterance: jebnu likr.ikǯi t’ap’nu rakːinra uc̊’ru mu.
unit.utterance_translation: He kicked open the door with his legs and went in.

unit.utterance: assalam alejkum, aˁχur k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Assalam aleykum, master.

unit.utterance: vaalejkum salam k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Wa aleykum salam.

unit.utterance: hap’nu, selim, k’ur jicar našti k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: How are you, Selim? Where are the oxen?

unit.utterance: jada k’ur, di<r>kuz daršiǯi ʁarzlamina ʁušnu k’ur jicar.
unit.utterance_translation: Oh my, I couldn't keep hold of them and they went off the cliff.

unit.utterance: jada uvu jiz χal gidipuvaki, selim k’ur, hap’uva k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Selim, you've ruined my house, what have you done?

unit.utterance: qaˁl afunuz, aˁχur k’ur?
unit.utterance_translation: Are you angry, master?

unit.utterance: vaʔ, vaʔ k’ur, qaˁl ʁafundoz k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: No, no, I am not angry!

unit.utterance: aˁ<b>qːi k’ur ip’rub.
unit.utterance_translation: Bring some food.

unit.utterance: dip’u ip’rubra daqru mu, givu k’ul.ig χlara.
unit.utterance_translation: He ate food and lay down to sleep, hands under his head.

unit.utterance: mu jiʁra aˁ<b>ʁuru.
unit.utterance_translation: This day had passed.

unit.utterance: qajiʁ.a tuvru muvaxna gamšar.
unit.utterance_translation: The next day he gave him water buffalo.

unit.utterance: lig ha, selim, k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Look, Selim.

unit.utterance: murar k’ur iχtijatǯi laˁχin ap’i k’ur, murar k’ur gamšar u k’ur, tünt gamšar u k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Work carefully with them, these are buffalo, they are violent.

unit.utterance: sab fikira map’a, aˁχur, k’ur, uzu durar.in ʁajʁu zigarza k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Don't worry, master, I will take care of them.

unit.utterance: ʁuˁru mu izn.iz, ap’uru izan sa c’ib vaχt.na hamu jiʁan si.
unit.utterance_translation: He went to the field and ploughed for a little while, like the previous day.

unit.utterance: liguru, udu<b>c̊’uru riʁ, mani šula, ʁuˁradar fužk’ara.
unit.utterance_translation: He looked: the sun was rising, it was getting hotter, nobody was coming.

unit.utterance: hamu jicar hats̊lakːina deetura gamšara.
unit.utterance_translation: He led the buffalo down to the place the oxen (fell down).

unit.utterance: erčnu gamšara ʁada<b>ʁu qibnu t’ul, jeburu us̊us̊ ʁuˁru mu qajiʁanna.
unit.utterance_translation: He pushed the buffalo [off the cliff], took the stick, whistled, and came back the next day.

unit.utterance: ja k’ur t’ap’nu rakːinra, ja aˁχuˁr, k’ur assalamu alejkum k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: He opened the door and said: Hey, master, assalamu aleykum!

unit.utterance: jada fu abxnuš aˁjdoz k’ur, hap’rudarijav k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Hey, I don't know what happened, what happened (to the buffalo)?

unit.utterance: hamus.ǯiz č’at.na adavdar danev k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Haven't you taken them out until now?

unit.utterance: jada murar ǯi<r>ʁuz abxundazxa k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Hey, I couldn't stop them.

unit.utterance: ʁušnu k’ur jicar ʁušus̊lamina gamšara.
unit.utterance_translation: The buffalo also went down the place where the oxen went.

unit.utterance: ja kerim, uvu jiz χal gidipurava, hajaman k’ur, uvu hap’rer uva k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Selim, you are ruining my house, what are you doing?

unit.utterance: qaˁl ʁafunuz aˁχuˁr k’ur?
unit.utterance_translation: Are you angry, master?

unit.utterance: vaʔ, vaʔ k’ur, qaˁl ʁafundoz k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: No, no, I am not angry.

unit.utterance: dip’u uˁlla daqru selim.
unit.utterance_translation: Selim ate and went to sleep.

unit.utterance: qajiʁ.a havru marčːar.iq selim.
unit.utterance_translation: Next day he sent Selim to herd sheep.

unit.utterance: ʁaraχ k’ur, hamu izan bala dar k’ur, izan ǯara.dli ap’uru k’ur, uvu marčːar.ixna ʁaraχ k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Go, that field is not a problem, leave the field, someone else will do the field, you go look after the sheep.

unit.utterance: marčːar tuvru muvaxna, sab aˁχuˁ zurba liǯ marčːara havru mu č’urar.iz.
unit.utterance_translation: He gave him sheep, a huge herd of sheep, and sent him to a pasture.

unit.utterance: dumu deetnu č’urar.iz marčːara daxnu daqru hams̊.ax.
unit.utterance_translation: He left the sheep on the pasture, they lay down and he lay down in the same place.

unit.utterance: sab ar.i haklimina haˁjvnar.iinǯi ʁuˁra admir, šubur, juq’ur kas ʁuˁra.
unit.utterance_translation: After some time, men came down there riding on horses, three or four people came.

unit.utterance: murar haklimina gafar ap’uri, jarab, allah uxuz tuvru marčːar diqudajk’e uxuz k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: They were talking down there: Oh God, can't we find sheep to buy!

unit.utterance: maha k’ur hams̊axra marčːar xaǯa k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Here are sheep.

unit.utterance: hajaman, hamrar.i marčːar tuvredar vu šul ha k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: Oh, maybe they are selling sheep.

unit.utterance: ja χalu
unit.utterance_translation: Hey, uncle.

unit.utterance: fu gunǯac̊uz k’ur?
unit.utterance_translation: What do you want?

unit.utterance: marčːar gunǯačuz k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: We want sheep.

unit.utterance: maha k’ur marčːar.
unit.utterance_translation: Here are the sheep.

unit.utterance: qa fuq’a tuvuz šulc̊xa k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: How many can you give?

unit.utterance: fuq’a gunǯac̊uz k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: How many do you want?

unit.utterance: qa učuz axiš hamrar vari k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: We would like all of them.

unit.utterance: vari uc̊uziz k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: All of mine are yours.

unit.utterance: pulra čavir k’ur, ʁejeχir marčːar.
unit.utterance_translation: Give me money, take the sheep.

unit.utterance: hisab dap’nu čpː.in ʁul.aǯiq’a gadadavǯi tuvnu marčːar javaš ap’uru χanuχri.
unit.utterance_translation: He counted (the money), he didn't drive (the sheep) to their village, he gave them away, and did [this business] quietly.

unit.utterance: ʁuˁru selim haklimina, ʁada<b>ʁu pulla, ibu ǯib.ǯi, qibu t’ulra gardan.ǯiq, jeburi us̊us̊, χaˁbaˁq.ǯi ʁuˁru, selim.
unit.utterance_translation: Selim came back, took the money, put it in his pocket, put the crook on his shoulders, whistled, and came back in the everning.

unit.utterance: uduc̊’uru admi ulixna.
unit.utterance_translation: The man went out.

unit.utterance: ja selim, marčːar naštːi a k’ur?
unit.utterance_translation: Hey, Selim, where are the sheep?

unit.utterance: tunza k’ur marčːar.
unit.utterance_translation: I've sold the sheep.

unit.utterance: šl.iz tuva k’ur?
unit.utterance_translation: Whom did you sell them to?

unit.utterance: jada haks̊a χanuχrir alaxnu k’ur tunza k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: I met friends down there and I sold them to them.

unit.utterance: ficːi tuva k’ur?
unit.utterance_translation: How could you sell (my sheep)?

unit.utterance: jiz marčːar uvu ficːi tuva k’ur?
unit.utterance_translation: How could you sell my sheep?

unit.utterance: hacːi tunza k’ur.
unit.utterance_translation: I just sold them like that.

unit.utterance: qaˁl ʁafunuz k’ur?
unit.utterance_translation: Are you angry?

unit.utterance: aˁχ ap’undar muvu sanu.
unit.utterance_translation: He couldn't bear it [lit. did not do patience].

unit.utterance: uvu fu abxida jiz k’ul.ʔin ala<b>qu bala, hatmu, hamu qaˁl ʁafige nuˁq’nar dap’nu.
unit.utterance_translation: What a problem you are, fallen on my head! He got angry and scolded him.

unit.utterance: ʁada<b>ʁu selim.ǯi k’ark’ar u<b>c̊’nu fn.iʔ.
unit.utterance_translation: Selim took a knife and stabbed (the man) in his belly.

unit.utterance: duk’u hamu admi hadmu devletra ʁada<b>ʁnu, du<b>χnu selim.ǯi ajibč’a uǯudar fira dap’nu χʷl.ara jis̊.ara hamcːi dulanmiš šulu.
unit.utterance_translation: Selim killed that man, took his wealth, brought everything, did whatchamacallit in the house, at this place, and lived this way.

unit.utterance: hamcːi laˤχnar u.
unit.utterance_translation: That was it.
